_header: All manner of men that lust for to hear
Title(s): ‘the coppie of the table that was hanging in the priorie of Stone at the time of the suppression’
_description: Rhyming history of the House of Stafford: ‘the coppie of the table that was hanging in the priorie of Stone at the time of the suppression’ — couplets

BodDod55.First Lines:
All manner of men that lust for to heereHow this Monasterie was
                    founded here…
BodDod55.Last Lines:
…Besides his ffader Erle Hugh as you may see in a faire new
                    tombe here buried is hee
BodDod55.Attributed Title:
The Coppie of the table that was hanging in the Priorie of Stone att the
                    time of the suppression of the same in the xxix-th yeare of the Raigne of our
                    Soueraigne Lorde King Henry the fourth (f. 102)
BodDod55.Editions:
Dugdale,  Sir William. 
             Monasticon Anglicanum.
         London: Hodgkinsonne, 1655; rev. eds. R. Dodsworth, J. Stevens,
            etc: 6.230.
